text: Kochi Metro Rail Limited, abbreviated to KMRL, is a centre-state public sector company in Kochi, Kerala, India, that operates the Kochi Metro and Kochi Water Metro. The company was incorporated on 2 August 2011.https://www.zaubacorp.com/company/KOCHI-METRO-RAIL- LIMITED/U60100KL2011SGC029003 About company The KMRL is also involved in the planning and implementation of Metro cycle, Metro taxi, Metro bus Services. == History == Kochi Metro Rail Limited (KMRL) is a Special Purpose Vehicle (SPV) formed for the implementation, operation and maintenance of Kochi Metro Rail Project as per orders from Planning Commission and the Union Government. KMRL is a joint venture company with equal equity contribution of Government of India and Government of Kerala. == Projects == Initially the project was Phase -I, Aluva to Petta and Phase -II JLN Stadium to Info Park. In Phase-I, KMRL proposed to have 22 stations covering a distance of 25 km from Aluva to Petta. KMRL now has 16http://www.thehindu.com/news/cities/Kochi/kochi-metros-new- stretch-to-be-inaugurated-today/article19787565.ece 16 Kochi Metro running stations operational stations covering a distance of 18.4 km from Aluva to Maharajas College. Again the project extended from Petta to SN Junction as Phase IA. The Phase -III from Aluva to Angamaly is pending for approval. == See also == * Transport in Kochi * Kochi Water Metro * Kochi Metro == References == Category:Kochi Metro Category:Indian companies established in 2011 Category:Companies based in Kochi Category:Rapid transit companies of India Category:Transport companies established in 2011
title: Kochi Metro Rail Limited
